ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert udp $HOME_NET any <> $EXTERNAL_NET any ( msg:"PUA-P2P Bittorrent uTP peer request"; content:"info_hash"; content:"get_peers",fast_pattern,nocase; metadata:policy max-detect-ips drop; reference:url,www.bittorrent.org/beps/bep_0000.html; classtype:policy-violation; sid:16282; rev:5; )

ids_alerts.rule_msg: ET P2P BitTorrent DHT ping request
ids_alerts.rule_raw: alert udp $HOME_NET any -> $EXTERNAL_NET any (msg:"ET P2P BitTorrent DHT ping request"; content:"d1|3a|ad2|3a|id20|3a|"; depth:12; nocase; threshold: type both, count 1, seconds 300, track by_src; reference:url,wiki.theory.org/BitTorrentDraftDHTProtocol; reference:url,doc.emergingthreats.net/bin/view/Main/2008581; classtype:policy-violation; sid:2008581; rev:3; metadata:created_at 2010_07_30, updated_at 2010_07_30;)

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Creates hidden files, links and/or directories
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
May try to detect the virtual machine to hinder analysis (VM artifact strings found in memory)
Opens /proc/net/route. Can be used to find connected routers
Executes the "iptables" command used for managing IP filtering and manipulation
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports

text_highlighted: iptables v1.8.4 (legacy): Couldn't load target `CWMP_CR':No such file or directory
iptables: No chain/target/match by that name.

signature_matches.description: Sample contains only a LOAD segment without any section mappings
Static ELF header machine description suggests that the sample might not execute correctly on this machine.
Executes the "iptables" command used for managing IP filtering and manipulation
Connects to IPs without corresponding DNS lookups
May try to detect the virtual machine to hinder analysis (VM artifact strings found in memory)
Uses the "uname" system call to query kernel version information (possible evasion)
Opens /proc/net/* files useful for finding connected devices and routers
Executes the "iptables" command to insert, remove and/or manipulate rules
Enumerates processes within the "proc" file system
Executes commands using a shell command-line interpreter
Samples exit code indicates no error despite standard error output
Detected TCP or UDP traffic on non-standard ports
ELF contains segments with high entropy indicating compressed/encrypted content
Static ELF header machine description suggests that the sample might only run correctly on MIPS or ARM architectures.
